contentrichtext.text: {{For|the New Zealand yachtsman|Robert Stewart (sailor)}} '''Robert Leslie Stewart''' (April 1918 – 1 November 1989), from [[Edinburgh]], [[Scotland]], also known as '''Jock Stewart''',<ref>{{Harvnb|Fielding|2008|p=237}}</ref> was one of the last [[executioner]]s in the United Kingdom, officiating between 1950 and 1964. Brought up close to Edinburgh's [[Saughton Prison]], Stewart completed the [[Prison Commission (England and Wales)|Prison Commissioners']] Assistant Executioner training course in September 1950 at [[Pentonville Prison]] in London. His name first appeared on the [[Home Office]] list in 1950, with his first engagement occurring at [[Norwich]] on 19 July 1951, assisting [[Stephen Wade (executioner)|Stephen Wade]] at the execution of Alfred Reynolds.<ref>{{Harvnb|Fielding|2008|p=287}}</ref> Stewart was active on the [[Home Office]] list between 1950 and the suspension of capital punishment for murder in 1965, carrying out 21 executions as assistant. On the 1957 printing of the list, Stewart and [[Harry Allen (executioner)|Harry Allen]] were both promoted to the role of executioner in the wake of the resignation of [[Albert Pierrepoint]] and the death of Wade, both in 1956. In this capacity, Stewart carried out six executions. He also assisted Harry Allen at the execution of [[Anthony Miller (murderer)|Anthony Miller]], the last teenager to be executed in the United Kingdom. Stewart performed one of the last executions in the United Kingdom at 8 am on 13 August 1964, when he hanged [[Peter Anthony Allen]] at [[Liverpool (HM Prison)|Walton Prison]]. Allen had been convicted of the murder of [[John Alan West]]; Allen's accomplice, [[Gwynne Owen Evans]], was hanged at [[Strangeways Prison]] in [[Manchester]], at the same time by Harry Allen. Stewart also carried out the last execution in Wales, that of Vivian Teed at [[Swansea]] Prison in May 1958, for the murder of a postmaster during a robbery in Swansea. Stewart died in South Africa, aged 71, in November 1989. He had emigrated after the abolition of Capital Punishment to work as an airline engineer and not, as has been speculated{{by whom|date=December 2011}}, as a hangman. ==Executions performed by Stewart as head executioner== * 6 May 1958 – Vivian Teed ([[HMP Swansea]]) * 17 December 1958 – Brian Chandler ([[HMP Durham]]) * 14 May 1959 – Michael Tatum ([[HMP Winchester]]) * 10 November 1960 – Norman Harris ([[HMP Pentonville]], London) * 17 December 1963 - [[Dennis Whitty]] ([[HMP Winchester]]) * 13 August 1964 – [[Murder of John Alan West|Peter Anthony Allen]] ([[HMP Liverpool]]) ==References== ;Notes {{reflist}} ;Bibliography {{refbegin}} *{{citation |last=Fielding |first=Steve |title=The Executioner's Bible |publisher=John Blake Publishing |year=2008 |isbn=978-1-84454-648-0}} {{refend}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Stewart,Robert Leslie | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =British executioner | DATE OF BIRTH = 1918 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 30 April 1988 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stewart, Robert Leslie}} [[Category:1918 births]] [[Category:1988 deaths]] [[Category:Scottish executioners]] [[Category:People from Edinburgh]] {{Scotland-bio-stub}}
